choices.name: Get started with research for your Maine ancestors.

hidden.content:
• Learn successful research strategies for Maine ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Selection Table to determine priorities for Maine research.

content.text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Maine research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Maine Research Tips and Strategies
    ☆ AA—Maine Genealogy

  2. Follow this research study for Maine ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Maine Research, 1880-Present

  3. Ancestry: Explore resources for Maine research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Maine Resources
    ☆ AC—Maine State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  4. Record Finder: Use the Maine Record Finder to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Maine Record Selection Table

  5. Find basic Maine genealogy resources.

    ☆ AR—Maine Genealogical Resources

    6. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

    Ethnic
    1. African American: Learn about African American research and resources.

      ☆ FS—African American Resources for Maine

    2. Learn more about African American records.

      ☆ AG—Maine African American Records

    3. Explore the African American Gateway for Maine.


Additional Records
  1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
Ethnic
  1. African American: Learn about African American research and resources.

    ☆ FS—African American Resources for Maine

  2. Learn more about African American records.

    ☆ AG—Maine African American Records

  3. Explore the African American Gateway for Maine.

1. Explore Maine historical resources on FamilySearch.

    ☆ FS—Maine History

  2. Explore Maine history on Wikipedia.

    ☆ History
    ☆ History of Maine

  3. Learn about Maine history on InfoPlease.com.

    ☆ Maine History

choices.name: Learn about Maine archives and libraries.

hidden.content:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Maine archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Maine Archives and Libraries
    ☆ Maine State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research
  2. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Maine.
  3. Explore the Digital Maine site.
  4. Explore the Maine Memory Network.
  5. Explore the Maine State Archives collections.
  6. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Maine genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  7. Search for ☆free online books on Maine research on the FamilySearch site.
  8. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.content:
• Explore city and county directories to find Maine ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city directories. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Maine city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Maine Directories

  2. Sites: Explore Maine city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore Maine city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore Maine ☆historical directories by county.
  6. Explore additional links for Maine city directories on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or Maine County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for Maine.

content.text:
Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

  1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the Maine Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the Maine Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Maine Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the U.S. Northeast Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  4. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Maine.

Regional Groups

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Maine research.
  2. Explore the Maine research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Maine research.

hidden.content: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

content.text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in Maine in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Maine Societies

  2. Explore the Maine Genealogical Society site.
  3. Explore the Maine Historical Society site.
  4. Explore Maine genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  5. Get help at a family history center in Maine.
